meta.name: description
meta.content: The Web pages of the Truro Central School

div.div:
﻿Welcome to Truro Central School
​ 8:20 A.M. - 2:50 P.M. ​

em.font: The Truro School System fosters a healthy, secure, and supportive atmosphere which develops the intellectual, physical, social, and creative potential of each individual. We are a nurturing community that challenges and prepares students to accept the responsibilities of citizenship and leadership, and to recognize and assess critically the values and directions of our global society. Throughout the curriculum and in all activities, we endeavor to create a positive, productive atmosphere that promotes respect for learning, self esteem, concern for others, and mastery of decision-making skills.

div.div:
While school is closed, all Truro children ages 3-18 are eligible to receive food free of charge from Truro Central School. A supply of breakfast and lunch food for an entire week is available for pick up (or delivery if necessary) at TCS each Tuesday from 10am-12pm. If you have not already done so please call 508-487-1558 x 203 by 12pm the Friday before to reserve. When you call, leave family name, number of children, allergies or dietary restrictions and address for delivery if needed. Deliveries are only available in Truro. Please indicate in your message if you would like to be placed on the permanent list thus eliminating the need to call in weekly.
Please pull up to the side door of the cafeteria and remain in your vehicle. Bags of food will be placed in your trunk. Once you have received your bags, please promptly exit the parking lot allowing for a quick, safe and efficient food distribution process.
​
If your child needs a device, please email rosenkampffk@truromass.org or harnede@truromass.org
Pick up for devices will be Tuesdays between 10:00 - 12:00. We are asking you to please pull up to the curb, stay in your car and open the trunk. A staff member will bring the device out and place it in your trunk.

​Dear TCS Families:
I hope you are all safe and healthy while we are all hunkering down during the COVID-19 Pandemic. All of us at TCS appreciate you connecting with us through our online educational enrichment activities.
Please keep this in mind; we do not expect you to replicate a school day with your children. We want your kids to select some of the teacher suggested activities on a daily basis Monday through Friday. We are cognizant that elementary school children do not need to spend hours online working on digital educational activities to practice learning. Reading books, supervised nature walks, home cooking, creative play opportunities and exercise are just some of the ways to reinforce what we have been teaching at school. We want TCS kids to be physically, emotionally and educationally safe and healthy during the school closure.
Please look at the engaging digital resources and activities that are available on the Puma Paw Page and your child’s teacher classroom pages on the TCS Website. These resources can help you make healthy decisions pertaining to reinforcing your child’s learning.
Please stay connected with us. We miss all of you. Be safe and stay healthy.
Sincerely,
Mr.Beaudet
Spring is springing in Truro! Your spring artwork looks amazing in the windows!

span.style: display: table-caption; caption-side: bottom; font-size: 90%; margin-top: -10px; margin-bottom: 10px; text-align: center;

br.br:
​March 20, 2020
Dear TCS Families,
These are unprecedented times. I hope you are practicing social distancing with your loved ones and members of your community as we navigate this international pandemic.
Our teachers and staff have been working remotely this week to provide TCS students with educational enrichment activities that will be available during the school closure. We are offering enrichment activities for children. We are not providing new instruction.
We will roll out the enrichment activities on Monday, March 23 after 8:00 a.m.
Your child’s classroom teacher will contact you on Monday morning. We are using the Truro Central School Website, classroom pages, and Google Classroom to communicate the enrichment activities to our families. Communication will be by email or protocols that are already in place with Ms. Raymond and
Mr. L-P.
If you need an electronic devise contact the main office. We will make arrangements for you to get the device.
Keep your eyes on your emails and the school website for any new information or updates.
Please be safe to support staying healthy.
Sincerely,
Mr. Beaudet
​
​
​

h2.a: Department of Elementary and Secondary Education (DESE)​Educational Resources for Students and Families

div.font:
Comcast Free Internet for Low Income Households
Please click on the link below

strong.font: Guidance Office, please click on the Guidance Office link to read Mrs. Winslow's tips for families.

div.br:
If you reside outside of the Town of Truro and would like your children to attend Kindergarten through sixth grade at Truro Central School, please see the following timeline.
April 1: Application period will commence for the following school year.
Applicants with siblings currently attending TCS will be placed first, prior to an enrollment lottery.
June 5: Spring lottery (if there are more applicants than existing seats)
Students not accepted in the Spring lottery will be placed on a waiting list.
Applications received after the June 6 lottery will be kept separate from the waiting list.
​
July 17: Summer lottery (if needed) for seats not filled by the June 6 lottery or waiting list.
If seats remain after the July 16 lottery and there is no waiting list, students may be accepted as parents apply until a date specified by the principal, or until the available seats are filled.
If you are interested in enrolling for the 2020-21 school year
please fill out the school choice form and registration form and email to harnede@truromass.org

strong.font: Apply to be a Substitute at TCS!

br.font: Truro Central School is seeking applications for on-call substitute positions including: substitute teachers($100.) substitute educational assistants($75.); substitute custodians; substitute cafeteria workers; substitute nurse($150.) Please submit a letter of application, resume and references to Kathy Rosenkampff - rosenkampffk@truromass.org or Truro Central School POB 2029 Truro MA 02666. E.O.E.

h2.font: The reading dogs are back for another school year! Thank you Maureen for bringing this amazing program to TCS.

div.div: click above to go to the TCS Facebook page

hr.h2: ​Shop for TCS Student Artwork on ARTSONIA!

td.div:
Art teacher Kim Possee curates our Artsonia page. Here you will find uploads of student artwork organized by grade and project. You can order many different items with the child's piece on it. There are 25 different keepsakes to choose from including t-shirts, cutting boards, mugs, note cards, puzzles, and ceramic tiles. Not only do you or someone you love receive a beautiful piece of art, but Truro Central School's Art Program receives 20% of each purchase! Great gifts for friends and family! You can also register and leave comments for students!
​Click here or on the logo to enter the site.
